image.altText: Tasmania Police shoulder patch

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian government is planning new laws that will better recognise hatred and prejudice as a motivation for crimes, but there are fears the changes won't work without better resourcing and systems for police.

title.children: Will new Tasmanian hate crime laws make a difference?

image.altText: Scenic coastal picture taken by drone, shows calm ocean, sand and coastal scrub on a clear day.

props.synopsis: Tasman Peninsula residents say poor telecommunications infrastructure is leading to delayed emergency responses and is hurting small businesses. The Albanese government has promised to rollout better coverage if re-elected.

title.children: 'We could have lost a life': Tasman Peninsula locals scathing of telco network

image.altText: A zinc factory in the foreground with pipes and steam venting and Mt Wellington towering behind in the distance.

props.synopsis: The Nyrstar zinc smelter on the banks of Hobart's River Derwent, which directly employs 550 workers, will scale back production by a quarter.

title.children: 'Significant challenges': Major Hobart employer to reduce production by a quarter

image.altText: A man in a spacesuit stands behind the counter of a shiny silver coffee van.

props.synopsis: Hamish wears a spacesuit to work every day to break the ice in starting chats, and the rewards extend well beyond good trade.

title.children: How an ex-Londoner put on a spacesuit and found acceptance in rural Australia

image.altText: Newborn in hosptial crib

props.synopsis: Tasmanian women will soon only have one private hospital option for maternity services. What does it mean for women at such a momentous time in their lives?

title.children: TassieCast: Are Tasmania's health services for women up to scratch?

image.altText: Strike it Out founder Kirsten Ritchie

props.synopsis: A trailer fitted with sleeping pods intended to give homeless people a safe and warm place to sleep at night is up for sale after a charity was refused permission to operate them on council land.

title.children: 'We've just wasted our time': Charity to sell homeless sleeping pods

image.altText: Fatty globules washed up on a sandy beach

props.synopsis: Tasmania's Environment Protection Authority has found low levels of antibiotic present in fatty salmon globules that have been washing up on south-east Tasmanian beaches following a mass salmon die-off. The Public Health Director says the antibiotic does not pose a risk to animal or human health.

title.children: Low levels of antibiotic detected in salmon material found on Tasmanian beaches

image.altText: Two Indigenous women smile at the camera in a composite image that includes a black and white photo and red desert.

props.synopsis: It has been more than 40 years since the Pintupi Nine made contact with the modern world. Much has changed in their lives, but their country has never stopped calling them home.

title.children: For years, these sisters didn't know white people existed

image.altText: A woman with dark hair smiles for a portrait.

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation reveals police may have failed to identify another victim of convicted healthcare killer Garry Davis, who was found guilty of murdering two nursing home residents and attempting to kill a third by injecting them with lethal doses of insulin.

title.children: Retired detective queries police investigation of aged care killer

image.altText: A cargo ship at sea with many colourful containers.

props.synopsis: If the events of the past few weeks have proven anything, it is that free trade agreements are worthless, at least when it comes to trade.

title.children: How America ripped off Australia with 'free trade'

image.altText: Burned out and dizzy female person with hands covering face. Vector illustration.

props.synopsis: Health anxiety, which is characterised by excessive worrying about illness, is a real condition that can — somewhat ironically — make you sick. But it's also treatable.

title.children: 'It's debilitating': How Dr Google can make you sick

image.altText: A man in glasses and a south african coloured scarf

props.synopsis: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio says South Africa's ambassador to the United States "is no longer welcome" in the country, accusing him of hating US President Donald Trump.

title.children: South African ambassador 'no longer welcome', US Secretary of State says

image.altText: A woman with long blonde hair

props.synopsis: Wendy Williams tossed a note pleading for help from the window of the assisted care facility where she's been living for three years, reopening a debate about legal guardianships in the US.

title.children: A beloved US talk show host says she's imprisoned in a care facility

image.altText: Cleary

props.synopsis: North Melbourne coach Alastair Clarkson defends Jackson Archer after young Bulldog Luke Cleary was stretchered from the field after a horrible clash.

title.children: Coaches defend incident after young Bulldog cops horrific knee to the head

image.altText: Matty Nicholson celebrates

props.synopsis: The Raiders make another statement by beating the Broncos in Canberra. Earlier the Rabbitohs came from 12 points down to steal a victory from the Dragons in Wollongong and the Cowboys were thrashed for a second-straight week, this time at home by the Sharks.

title.children: Raiders blast past Broncos to deliver another statement victory

image.altText: Tom Gleeson standing with his arms crossed with a serious look on his face with th Hard quiz logo in the top left corner

props.synopsis: Back again? I doubt you'll do any better than last week.

title.children: You better believe I’m here to judge you. Let’s play… HARD!

image.altText: A white man with cropped hair and glasses wearing a blue shirt stands with his hands in his pockets against a wall

props.synopsis: Robert Lukins' third novel is a Succession-like saga set in a wealthy enclave in Connecticut in the 1990s.

title.children: Author admits 'monstrous' characters are drawn from himself

image.altText: Lando Norris driving his orange F1 car around a corner

props.synopsis: McLaren's Lando Norris has produced a storming lap to claim pole position for Sunday's Formula 1 Australian Grand Prix.

title.children: Norris pips Piastri for McLaren front row lockout in Australian Grand Prix

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: A man with strawberry blonde hair looks at the camera with a serious face.

props.synopsis: Two years ago, former NBL player Harry Froling was laying in a hospital bed fighting for his life. Now he's set on coming back better than ever.

title.children: After a sickening one-punch attack, Harry Froling was told he'd never play basketball again

image.altText: A small boat heads towards a turbine in the ocean.

props.synopsis: Offshore wind faces community and political opposition as well support for its promise of ample renewable energy and while some claims can be ruled out, experts say other concerns are valid.

title.children: Do offshore turbines kill whales? Wind farm facts, fiction and unknowns

image.altText: A couple with their premature baby

props.synopsis: As Tropical Cyclone Alfred neared the Queensland coast, toppling trees and downing powerlines, more than 2000 health workers in the state's south bunkered down in hospitals to ensure patients were well cared for.

title.children: Mum reunites with premature baby after Cyclone Alfred forced them apart

image.altText: An Aboriginal woman standing among a group of colourful graves with mosaic headstones.

props.synopsis: An Aboriginal community in far west New South Wales works through grief for lost loved ones with a hands-on project using the art of mosaic.

title.children: 'Represents how broken you feel': Mosaic headstones help people with grief

image.altText: A photo of a woman on display at a rally in Melbourne

props.synopsis: As Australians across the country rally to call for greater funding and legal change to stop violence against women, organiser Sherele Moody calls out men for not doing enough.

title.children: Rallies call for more government funding to end violence against women

image.altText: A woman in a shearer's singlet leans against a wooden wall in shearing shed

props.synopsis: After her first day shearing, Mikayla Hall's hands were covered in blisters. Three years later she's one of the fastest female shearers in Australia.

title.children: Mikayla shears to earn an income but on weekends she does it for fun

image.altText: A fire rages at night time, with trees burning.

props.synopsis: A fire raging near Mount Dandenong overnight destroys one home and damages another, with authorities residents to remain on alert as about 200 firefighters continue to battle the blaze.

title.children: One home lost as firefighters battle bushfire in Melbourne's east

image.altText: A Culex quinquefasciatus mosquito

props.synopsis: Health officials have warned people in recently flooded areas of the country to protect against mosquito-borne diseases after a new case of Japanese encephalitis was detected in NSW.

title.children: Why Japanese encephalitis cases are rising in Australia

image.altText: A young man with a cap and light brown shirt standing onboard of a paddle steamer.

props.synopsis: While some 22-year-olds are saving for a house, an Adelaide man has purchased a piece of paddle-steaming history, hoping to save money on housing as well as satisfying his inland shipping history interests.

title.children: Historic paddleboat becomes cheap alternative to 'expensive' housing for shipwright

image.altText: GettyImages-2205246557

props.synopsis: The Delhi Capitals fall to the Mumbai Indians in the WPL final as Meg Lanning's quest for ultimate victory comes up short again.

title.children: 'We're bitterly disappointed': Lanning's Delhi Capitals fall at the final hurdle

image.altText: A newspaper headline from the 1960s says reads "Spy Ring Plan, sought rocket secrets".

props.synopsis: Intelligence agencies, politicians and spies offer support for a proposed National Spy Museum in Canberra, which would portray the nation's history of espionage and pay tribute to those who have spied.

title.children: 'Everybody loves a spy story': National Spy Museum proposed for Canberra

image.altText: Mary Fowler

props.synopsis: Mary Fowler's Manchester City go down to Chelsea in the Women's League Cup final, as Sam Kerr's return draws closer.

title.children: Heartbreak for Fowler in League Cup final as Kerr's return draws closer

image.altText: a man, woman and child pose out the front of a pub

props.synopsis: In the southern Queensland town of Laidley, floodwaters come and go but the people stay.

title.children: The town that keeps flooding but no-one wants to leave

image.altText: A US influencer holding a joey wombat that is in distress with its mouth open

props.synopsis: American influencer Sam Jones says she was trying to remove the joey from the side of a roadway, where it might have been hit by a passing vehicle.

title.children: US influencer apologises for snatching baby wombat from its mother

image.altText: black stain on a ship in the sea

props.synopsis: Vladimir Motin was captain of a cargo ship that hit a tanker, carrying jet fuel for the US military, off England in the North Sea at close to full speed this week.

title.children: UK police charge Russian captain with manslaughter and gross negligence

image.altText: A vehicle on the salt surface of South Australia's Lake Gairdner.

props.synopsis: Since 1990, a growing band of enthusiasts has been annually returning to Lake Gairdner — and this year their number included a 96-year-old who reached 97mph on the smooth and dry salt surface.

title.children: Outback salt lake flooded with speedsters seeking the perfect run
